event.title: Cycles
event.name: CPU Cycles
event.description: The counter increments on every cycle.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Increment PMSWINC Register
event.description: The counter increments on writes to the PMSWINC register.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts instruction memory accesses that cause a refill of at least the Level 1 instruction or unified cache. This includes each instruction memory access that causes a refill from outside the cache. It excludes accesses that do not cause a new cache refill but are satisfied from refilling data of a previous miss.

event.title: L1 Instruction TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts instruction memory accesses that cause a TLB refill of at least the Level 1 instruction TLB. This includes each instruction memory access that causes an access to a level of memory system due to a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each memory-read operation or memory-write operation that causes a refill of at least the Level 1 data or unified cache from outside the Level 1 cache. Each access that causes a new linefill is counted, including those from instructions that generate multiple accesses, such as load or store multiples, and PUSH and POP instructions. In particular, the counter counts accesses to the Level 1 cache that cause a refill that is satisfied by another Level 1 data or unified cache, or a Level 2 cache, or memory.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts each memory-read operation or memory-write operation that causes a cache access to at least the Level 1 data or unified cache. Each access to a cache line is counted including the multiple accesses of instructions, such as LDM or STM . Each access to other Level 1 data or unified memory structures, for example refill buffers, write buffers, and write- back buffers, is also counted.

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each memory-read operation or memory-write operation that causes a TLB refill of at least the Level 1 data or unified TLB. It counts each read or write that causes a refill, in the form of a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Load
event.description: The counter increments for every executed memory-reading instruction.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Store
event.description: The counter increments for every executed memory-writing instruction, including SWP. The counter does not increment for a Store-Exclusive instruction that fails.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: All
event.description: The counter increments for every architecturally executed instruction.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Taken
event.description: The counter increments for each exception taken. The counter counts only the processor exceptions. It does not count untrapped floating-point exceptions or ThumbEE null checks and index checks.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Exception Returns
event.description: The counter increments for each executed exception return instruction.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to CONTEXTIDR
event.description: The counter increments for every write to the CONTEXTIDR.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to PC
event.description: The counter increments for every software change of the PC. This includes all: Branch instructions, memory reading instructions that explicitly write to the PC, Data processing instructions that explicitly write to the PC, and Exception return instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Immediate)
event.description: The counter counts all immediate branch instructions that are architecturally executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Return)
event.description: The counter counts all procedure return instructions that are architecturally executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Unaligned Load/Store
event.description: The counter counts each memory-reading instruction or memory-writing instruction that accesses an unaligned address.

event.title: Branch Predictor
event.name: Mispredictions
event.description: The counter counts each correction to the predicted program flow that occurs because of a misprediction from, or no prediction from, the branch prediction resources and that relates to instructions that the branch prediction resources are capable of predicting.

event.title: Branch Predictor
event.name: Possible Predictions
event.description: The counter counts every branch or other change in the program flow that the branch prediction resources are capable of predicting.

event.title: Java
event.name: Bytecode execute
event.description: Counts the number of Java bytecodes being decoded, including speculative ones

event.title: Java
event.name: SW bytecode execute
event.description: Counts the number of software Java bytecodes being decoded, including speculative ones

event.title: Jazelle
event.name: Backward branch execute
event.description: Counts the number of Jazelle taken branches being executed. This includes the branches that are flushed because of a previous load/store that aborts late.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Coherency miss
event.description: Counts the number of coherent linefill requests performed by the Cortex-A9 processor that also miss in all the other Cortex-A9 processors. This means that the request is sent to the external memory.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Coherency hit
event.description: Counts the number of coherent linefill requests performed by the Cortex-A9 processor that hit in another Cortex-A9 processor. This means that the linefill data is fetched directly from the relevant Cortex-A9 cache.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst dependent stall
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the processor: is ready to accept new instructions, does not receive a new instruction, because: the instruction side is unable to provide one or the instruction cache is performing at least one linefill

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data dependent stall
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the processor has some instructions that it cannot issue to any pipeline, and the Load Store unit has at least one pending linefill request, and no pending TLB requests

event.title: Cache
event.name: TLB stall
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the processor is stalled waiting for the completion of translation table walks from the main TLB. The processor stalls because the instruction side is not able to provide the instructions, or the data side is not able to provide the necessary data.

event.title: Intrinsic
event.name: STREX pass
event.description: Counts the number of STREX instructions architecturally executed and passed

event.title: Intrinsic
event.name: STREX fail
event.description: Counts the number of STREX instructions architecturally executed and failed

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data eviction
event.description: Counts the number of eviction requests because of a linefill in the data cache

event.title: Pipeline
event.name: Issue stage no dispatch
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the issue stage does not dispatch any instruction because it is empty or cannot dispatch any instructions

event.title: Pipeline
event.name: Issue stage empty
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the issue stage is empty

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Executed
event.description: Counts the number of instructions going through the Register Renaming stage. This number is an approximate number of the total number of instructions speculatively executed, and an even more approximate number of the total number of instructions architecturally executed. The approximation depends mainly on the branch misprediction rate.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data linefills
event.description: Counts the number of linefills performed on the external AXI bus. This event counts all data linefill requests, caused by: loads, including speculative ones, stores, PLD, prefetch or page table walk.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Prefetch linefills
event.description: Counts the number of data linefills caused by prefetcher requests

event.title: Cache
event.name: Prefetch hits
event.description: Counts the number of cache hits in a line that belongs to a stream followed by the prefetcher. This includes: lines that have been prefetched by the automatic data prefetcher and lines already present in the cache, before the prefetcher action.

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Return
event.description: Counts the number of procedure returns whose condition codes do not fail, excluding all returns from exception. This count includes procedure returns that are flushed because of a previous load/store that aborts late.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Main execution unit
event.description: Counts the number of instructions being executed in the main execution pipeline of the processor, the multiply pipeline and arithmetic logic unit pipeline. The counted instructions are still speculative.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Second execution unit
event.description: Counts the number of instructions being executed in the processor second execution pipeline (ALU). The counted instructions are still speculative.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Load/Store
event.description: Counts the number of instructions being executed in the Load/Store unit. The counted instructions are still speculative.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Floating point
event.description: Counts the number of floating-point instructions going through the Register Rename stage. Instructions are still speculative in this stage.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: NEON
event.description: Counts the number of NEON instructions going through the Register Rename stage. Instructions are still speculative in this stage.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: PLD
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the processor is stalled because PLD slots are all full

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Memory write
event.description: Counts the number of cycles when the processor is stalled. The data side is stalled also, because it is full and executes writes to the external memory.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Inst main TLB miss
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of main TLB misses on requests issued by the instruction side

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Data main TLB miss
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of main TLB misses on requests issued by the data side

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Inst micro TLB miss
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of micro TLB misses on the instruction side. This event does not include main TLB miss stall cycles that are already counted in the corresponding main TLB event.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Data micro TLB miss
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of micro TLB misses on the data side. This event does not include main TLB miss stall cycles that are already counted in the corresponding main TLB event.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: DMB
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of the execution of a DMB. This includes all DMB instructions being executed, even speculatively.

event.title: Clock
event.name: Integer core
event.description: Counts the number of cycles when the integer core clock is enabled

event.title: Clock
event.name: Data engine
event.description: Counts the number of cycles when the data engine clock is enabled

event.title: Clock
event.name: NEON
event.description: Counts the number of cycles when the NEON SIMD clock is enabled

event.title: Memory
event.name: TLB inst allocations
event.description: Counts the number of TLB allocations because of Instruction requests

event.title: Memory
event.name: TLB data allocations
event.description: Counts the number of TLB allocations because of Data requests

event.title: Instruction
event.name: ISB
event.description: Counts the number of ISB instructions architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: DSB
event.description: Counts the number of DSB instructions architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: DMB
event.description: Counts the number of DMB instructions speculatively executed

event.title: External
event.name: Interrupts
event.description: Counts the number of external interrupts executed by the processor

event.title: PLE
event.name: Cache line rq completed
event.description: Counts the number of PLE cache line requests completed

event.title: PLE
event.name: Cache line rq skipped
event.description: Counts the number of PLE cache line requests skipped

event.title: PLE
event.name: FIFO flush
event.description: Counts the number of PLE FIFO flush requests

event.title: PLE
event.name: Request completed
event.description: Counts the number of PLE FIFO flush completed

event.title: PLE
event.name: FIFO overflow
event.description: Counts the number of PLE FIFO flush overflowed

event.title: PLE
event.name: Request programmed
event.description: Counts the number of PLE FIFO flush program requests
